Introduction.Title: Motion Design Quick Start Guide
Introduction.Description: Get started with Motion Design, an Experimental feature for broadcast graphics creation.
Introduction.Caution: Use caution when shipping with it.

WhatIsMotionDesign.Description: Internal Editor plugin for broadcasting graphics, playout, and real-time data visualization for live TV.

Steps: Enable Motion Design and Storm Sync Motion Design Bridge plugins.
Create an empty level or use a template.
Select Motion Design template in Toolbar.
Use Deactivate Scene button or delete Default Scene group manually.

ToolBox.Description: Place parametric 2D/3D shapes, text, SVGs, cloners, and Media Plate.
ToolBox.Viewport: Zoom and select Motion Design Viewport.

ToolShortcuts.Description: Modifier and Transition Logic panels, accessed via Editor Panel Shortcuts.

Outliner.Description: Customized Unreal Engine Outliner with additional functionality.

Sequencer.Description: Create, modify, and preview animations with added Motion Design tools.

ModifiersStack.Description: Add and manage modifiers for selected actors.

AnimatorsStack.Description: Add and manage animators for selected actors.

RemoteControl.Description: Linked preset with parameters for actors, modifiers, and animators.

Broadcast.Description: Facilitates output of Motion Design assets on displays or media outputs.

Introduction.Title: Your First Graphic with Motion Design
Introduction.Description: Step-by-step guide to create an animated 2D graphic with Motion Design. Use caution as it's an Experimental feature.

Options: Use Motion Design in an existing level
Create a new level using Motion Design template

Steps: Add default actors using Create Defaults
Select Motion Design template for 2D design
Configure and spawn default scene actors
Create shapes using Motion Design toolbox
Select shape and open Material Designer
Set Material Type to Material Designer
Customize text properties in Details panel
Set keyframes for position and opacity
Set up Conditional Behavior for properties
